{"step_by_step_thinking": "The study design described in the question involves comparing the proportion of women who underwent a bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy between two groups: those with breast cancer and those without breast cancer. This type of study design is known as a case-control study. In a case-control study, individuals with a specific outcome (in this case, breast cancer) are compared to individuals without the outcome to determine if there is an association with a particular exposure or intervention (in this case, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy).", "answer_choice": "C. Case-control"}
